page.description: Returns a random number between 0 and 1.
page.discussion: RAND() returns a random number between 0 and 1.

section.description: The next time the function is evaluated, it will be a different number. You can generate random numbers between different limits. To generate a number between 0 and 100, for example, use the expression:

RAND() always generates the same sequence of numbers. You can get an unpredictable series by looping through the RAND() function loops times before starting to use its output. The following routine uses the current time to define loops.
section.example: loops = val( right( str( int( toseconds( time() ) ) ),3) ) ? loops = 507 for i = 1 to loops rand() next ? rand() = 0.338623046875
